title: utilities
content: # `prefect.client.utilities` Utilities for working with clients. ## Functions ### `get_or_create_client` ```python theme={null} get_or_create_client(client: Optional['PrefectClient'] = None) -> tuple['PrefectClient', bool] ``` Returns provided client, infers a client from context if available, or creates a new client. **Args:** * `- client`: an optional client to use **Returns:** * * tuple: a tuple of the client and a boolean indicating if the client was inferred from context ### `client_injector` ```python theme={null} client_injector(func: Callable[Concatenate['PrefectClient', P], Coroutine[Any, Any, R]]) -> Callable[P, Coroutine[Any, Any, R]] ``` ### `inject_client` ```python theme={null} inject_client(fn: Callable[P, Coroutine[Any, Any, R]]) -> Callable[P, Coroutine[Any, Any, R]] ``` Simple helper to provide a context managed client to an asynchronous function. The decorated function *must* take a `client` kwarg and if a client is passed when called it will be used instead of creating a new one, but it will not be context managed as it is assumed that the caller is managing the context.
